org.elasticsearch.test

Class CompositeTestCluster

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.elasticsearch.test.TestCluster
      • org.elasticsearch.test.CompositeTestCluster
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.lang.Iterable<org.elasticsearch.client.Client>

    public class CompositeTestCluster
extends TestCluster
    A test cluster implementation that holds a fixed set of external nodes as well as a InternalTestCluster which is used to run mixed version clusters in tests like backwards compatibility tests. Note: this is an experimental API

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.elasticsearch.test.TestCluster

      • upgradeOneNode

        public boolean upgradeOneNode()
                       throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                              java.io.IOException
        Upgrades one external running node to a node from the version running the tests. Commonly this is used to move from a node with version N-1 to a node running version N. This works seamless since they will share the same data directory. This method will return true iff a node got upgraded otherwise if no external node is running it returns false
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.io.IOException

      • upgradeAllNodes

        public boolean upgradeAllNodes()
                        throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                               java.io.IOException
        Upgrades all external running nodes to a node from the version running the tests. All nodes are shut down before the first upgrade happens.
        Returns:
        true iff at least one node as upgraded.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.io.IOException

      • upgradeAllNodes

        public boolean upgradeAllNodes(org.elasticsearch.common.settings.Settings nodeSettings)
                        throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                               java.io.IOException
        Upgrades all external running nodes to a node from the version running the tests. All nodes are shut down before the first upgrade happens.
        Parameters:
        nodeSettings - settings for the upgrade nodes
        Returns:
        true iff at least one node as upgraded.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.io.IOException

        Upgrades one external running node to a node from the version running the tests. Commonly this is used to move from a node with version N-1 to a node running version N. This works seamless since they will share the same data directory. This method will return true iff a node got upgraded otherwise if no external node is running it returns false

      • allowOnAllNodes

        public void allowOnAllNodes(java.lang.String... index)
        Allows allocation of shards of the given indices on all nodes in the cluster.

      • allowOnlyNewNodes

        public void allowOnlyNewNodes(java.lang.String... index)
        Allows allocation of shards of the given indices only on "new" nodes in the cluster. Note: if a shard is allocated on an "old" node and can't be allocated on a "new" node it will only be removed it can be allocated on some other "new" node.

      • startNewNode

        public void startNewNode()
        Starts a current version data node

      • ensureEstimatedStats

        public void ensureEstimatedStats()
        Description copied from class: TestCluster
        Ensures that any breaker statistics are reset to 0. The implementation is specific to the test cluster, because the act of checking some breaker stats can increase them.
        Specified by:
        ensureEstimatedStats in class TestCluster
